page.title: 17CARDING MILL LANE CANASTON
page.content: CARDING MILL LANE IS A PLEASANT WALK BETWEEN NARBERTH TOWN MOOR AND VALLEY ROAD.IT IS APPROXIMATELY A MILE LONG AND PASSES THROUGH QUIET WOODLAND OF DECIDUOUS TREES.MANY FLOWERS GROW ALONG THE PATH INCLUDING,BLUE BELLS, PRIMROSES,WILD ROSE AND VIOLETS.THERE IS A LARGE BADGER SETT QUITE CLOSE TO THE TRACK AND MANY BIRDS SING IN THE BUSHES.A SHORT WALK ALONG VALLEY ROAD TO THE WEST WILL BRING YOU TO CANASTON WOODS A LARGE CONIFEROUS FOREST COVERING THE SOUTH WEST CORNER OF OUR BLOCK. THE WOODS ARE CROSSED BY MANY BRIDLE PATHS,ONE OF WHICH BRINGS YOU TO AN ANCIENT HILL FORT.MODERN FORESTERS ARE WORKING CONSTANTLY, FELLING TREES AND MAKING FENCING POSTS AND PIT PROPS.MOUNTAIN CHURCH WAS CLOSED LAST YEAR AND HAS ALREADY BECOME SEMI-DERELICT.
